data.title: A place to come back for seconds
data.text: It's a place where they take pride in their food and customer service . Each and every time we have been back food has been consistent and the service on point .

data.title: Nice tipico decor; substitutions accepted; bright and clean
data.text: If you don't see it on the menu, just ask; usually you'll be accommodated.  If you don't want some of the items on a listed "plate," they're happy to make substitutions.  Reasonable prices, clean and airy little cafe.

data.title: Good food, low prices; ethnic atmosphere
data.text: This is a little no-frills cafe serving typical Mexican food.  Having lived on the border 1/3 of my life, I can tell you that the food is authentic and I find it delicious.  If it's not on the menu, ask for it anyway; they're willing to accommodate special orders and substitutions.

data.title: Food is good, location and decor not so much.
data.text: Mexico Lindo isn't in the best area of Lynn, and the decor isn't the best but the food is good. It's authentic mexican. The place has a few tables and a lunch counter. They seem to be very busy with take-out as well. We tried the burrito and the pork both were delicious. The salsas are not the typical chunky reds that are served in most mexican restaurants. Service was good, only 2 employees and both were very friendly. Prices were decent, I would return again.
